Message.Title: YAHOO anology
Message.Msg: In 2007 YHOO was trading between $30 and $34 per share, today you can buy YHOO at $22.00, a huge discount. In 2007 that $34.00 was worth much more as in purchase power compare to 20013. In few words if yahoo was trading at $30 today its still a bargain if you put into account inflation eroding the US $ since 2007.

Topic.Title: YAHOO anology

Message.Msg: That has to be the poorest reason to buy a stock I have ever seen. RIMM use to trade at $150. Is it undervalued now at $14?. So how does this sound? In 2001 YHOO was trading between $5 and $6 per share, today you can sell YHOO at $22.00, a huge premium. In 2001 that $5.00 was worth much more as in purchase power compare to 2013. In few words if yahoo was trading at $5 today its still over priced if you put into account inflation eroding the US $ since 2001.

Topic.Title: Any short think Yhoo is dead money at $22.34?

Message.Msg: HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA that question doesn't even make sense?!?!?! I know SoDumbKid says that "shut me up" but that kid has such low intelligence its pathetic. A short is a person betting the stock goes DOWN. A short would NEVER bet on "dead money" as that means no movement, impossible to make money. If a person bets on "dead money" they're using the decay of options to make money regardless where the stock goes. What I did back in August was write ITM options making me a synthetic long. I collected the money up front invested it in SID and Netflix(which has gone from $60 to $192) and covered it(bought back those written options) at $19.40. My return was infinite as I invested nothing. My share price was $14.30s IF assigned. Now last month I went short gaining .50 and one week ago I went short again so up on that as well(10% at the moment). What a laugh though!!!lol Maybe its time to use your Brainless_2004 ID what do you think???
